organization.fullName: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

identificationModule.briefTitle: EXtending the tIme Window of Thrombolysis by ButyphThalide up to 6 Hours After Onset (EXIT-BT)
identificationModule.officialTitle: EXtending the tIme Window of Thrombolysis by ButyphThalide up to 6 Hours After Onset (EXIT-BT): a Prospective, Randomized, Blinded Assessment of Outcome and Open Label Multi-center Study

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

leadSponsor.name: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To date, the time window of intravenous thrombolysis is limited within 4.5 hours of stroke onset. Although EXTEND study has proved that intravenous thrombolysis can be extended from 4.5 to 9 hours, but the eligible patients must be selected by CTP. Thus, it is of clinical importance how to extend the time window of intravenous thrombolysis, which can benifit more patients. The current trial aims to investigate the effect of intravenous thrombolysis with TNK from 4.5 to 6 hours in ischemic stroke with help of Butyphthalide, which was found to be neuroprotective.

armGroups.label: TNK group
armGroups.description: intravenous thrombolysis with 0.25 mg/kg TNK, with the biggest dose of 25 mg

primaryOutcomes.description: any evidence of bleeding on the head CT scan associated with clinically significant neurological deterioration (NIHSS score ≥4 points increase)

secondaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of modified Rankin Score are 0 and 6, respectively; higher score mean a worse outcome
the minimum and maximum values of modified Rankin Score are 0 and 6, respectively; higher score mean a worse outcome
the minimum and maximum values of modified Rankin Score are 0 and 6, respectively; higher score mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of NIHSS are 0 and 42, respectively; higher NIHSS mean a worse outcome
the evidence of bleeding on the head CT scan
CMB is measured by SWI sequence
infarct volume is measured by DWI sequence

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* age: 18-80;
* ischemic stroke confirmed by brain CT or MRI
* the time from onset to treatment: 4.5-6 hours
* NIHSS≥4
* prestroke mRS≤1
* signed informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* prestroke mRS≥2
* planned endovascular treatment
* planned intravenous thrombolysis based on WAKE-UP or EXTEND study criterion
* any contraindiction of intravenous thrombolysis
* other unsuitable conditions judged by investigator

locations.facility: Department of Neurology, General Hospital of Northern Theater Command
